heading: media metrix seeks ipo
subheading: the leading company in tracking web site visitors plans to raise up to us$48.3 million in a public offering.
author: wired news report
text: media metrix, the company that's gained influence counting visitors to web sites, is looking to cash in on its stature with a public stock offering. the company said thursday that it has filed registration papers with the securities and exchange commission. according to the news service federal filings, the company plans to sell up to us$48.3 million of common stock in its ipo.donaldson, lufkin & jenrette will be the lead underwriter of the offering, which is intended to raise money "to fund international expansion, new product development, [and] the redemption of outstanding redeemable preferred stock," the company said.media metrix was founded in 1996 and last year merged with competitor relevant knowledge, in the process becoming the web's undisputed ratings leaders. its reports, based on measuring the activities of 40,000 web users -- including those of proprietary systems like aol -- are widely cited.
